channel.title: 1st or 3rd
channel.description: Which view do you prefer for games where you are a person i don't mean RTS's what view do you prefer? give your reasons aswell

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Dyslexia

Dyslexia, also known as reading disorder, is characterized by trouble with reading despite normal intelligence. Different people are affected to varying degrees. Problems may include difficulties in spelling words, reading quickly, writing words, "sounding out" words in the head, pronouncing words when reading aloud and understanding what one reads. Often these difficulties are first noticed at school. When someone who previously could read loses their ability, it is known as al Dyslexia is be...

People with dyslexia are called dyslexic or dyslectic. ... [11] Many dyslexics overcome early problems with literacy and go on to earn advanced degrees and ...

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:15, topic:209932”]I agree Creed’s gameplay was amazing, especially the graphics and environments, if they work on NPC AI and add a wider variety of dialogues (many repetitions) then #2 will be amazing. Sure the story was a little repetitive but it was the first of it’s kind, they can only build on it! (More freedom being the key factor)

I completed in around 5 hours, that doesn’t mean I didn’t thoroughly enjoy it.[/quote]
if it were more like oblivion with its NPC interactions and the ability to enter buildings and change various aspects of the character it would’ve been better because the limited gameplay made it tire quickly
EDIT: [quote=“Thug-life, post:16, topic:209932”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=276430.msg2256199#msg2256199 date=1212363548]
It was epicly shit it had a good impact but that was it tonnes of people got bored of the game after the first few hours because they had nothing to do it was incredibly boring and lifeless
[/quote]
…
Are you actually reading my posts? Gameplay != Story/missions. The gameplay is how the player controls, the enviroment all that. Stop giving me this shit as it has nothing to do as what we are actually talking about.[/quote]
You brought it up

Read full topic

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I agree Creed’s gameplay was amazing, especially the graphics and environments, if they work on NPC AI and add a wider variety of dialogues (many repetitions) then #2 will be amazing. Sure the story was a little repetitive but it was the first of it’s kind, they can only build on it! (More freedom being the key factor)

I completed in around 5 hours, that doesn’t mean I didn’t thoroughly enjoy it.

Read full topic

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:13, topic:209932”]Shut the fuck up about the missions you ignorant fuck, i am not talking about them.

Like i said though, it worked for the millions of people who bought it and the game reviewers who rated it 8.5 - 9.5/10. It was as much about speed as it was about stealth.[/quote]
It was epicly shit it had a good impact but that was it tonnes of people got bored of the game after the first few hours because they had nothing to do it was incredibly boring and lifeless
PS: some guy replied to your post on this vid http://webtv.xleague.tv/watch.aspx?Video=The%20Match@416 before it was removed i checked out to see what had happened

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Shut the fuck up about the missions you ignorant fuck, i am not talking about them.

Like i said though, it worked for the millions of people who bought it and the game reviewers who rated it 8.5 - 9.5/10. It was as much about speed as it was about stealth.

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:11, topic:209932”]Holy shit, it did not ‘suck’ for the millions of people that bought it and loved the gameplay (Gameplay != story/missions). The gameplay worked fine, it was about speed AND stealth, get in, kill, get away FAST.

It was advertised as a stealthy game, but it really wasn’t.[/quote]
It wasnt that much about speed you had the aspect of hiding on a bench between two people and hiding inbetween guys in white robes the only speed side was leap of faith and it did suck epicly the gameplay was shit every mission was one and the same you’d done one mission you’d done em all. I completed it within a weekend with only 4-5 hours of actual gameplay, it was absolutely awful. Its main aim was stealth and nothing more the speed side wasn’t exagerated enough they had the climbing fair enough but that wasn’t fast paced or thrilling

Read full topic

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Holy shit, it did not ‘suck’ for the millions of people that bought it and loved the gameplay (Gameplay != story/missions). The gameplay worked fine, it was about speed AND stealth, get in, kill, get away FAST.

It was advertised as a stealthy game, but it really wasn’t.

Read full topic

Assasins creed also had the concept of ‘speed and being chased’ etc, and that worked perfectly for the millions of people that bought it.

Dude it sucked bad and it wasn’t about speed it was about stealth and stalking in the shadows if it were concentrated on speed it would be first person it was a ‘duck and cover’ sort of game

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:6, topic:209932”]Like i said on irc though, there is a reason they use first person for certain genres and a reason they use third for the others, its because it simply does not work and the majority prefer it that way.

Say on a game like mirrors edge, you have loads of people chasing you, you need to see all angles at once and you cannot in first person.[/quote]
Mirrors edge wouldn’t work 3rd person because the game is focused around speed and the thrill of the chase as it were and if it were 3rd person you are too fare away from the action kinda like a fly hovering behind

Read full topic

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Games like COD4 need 1st person, but hack ‘n’ slash and games which need you to utilise the environment (eg Assassin’s creed) require 3rd. So i therefore agree with Thug-life.

Read full topic

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Like i said on irc though, there is a reason they use first person for certain genres and a reason they use third for the others, its because it simply does not work and the majority prefer it that way.

Say on a game like mirrors edge, you have loads of people chasing you, you need to see all angles at once and you cannot in first person.

Read full topic

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:2, topic:209932”]First person only works on certain genres, just like 3rd person does. Its impossible to say which i prefer as i prefer each on different genres.
So i’m not voting.[/quote]
Unless i’m driving i will personally prefer 1st person all the way except for football games which i don’t play too often anyway

Read full topic

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

I like first for gun games, simply because it gives a real life touch.

For games like gta, I like 3rd because I like to be able to see all my surroundings(What car I want, etc)

Read full topic

item.title: 1st or 3rd
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

3rd person, because I can see more stuff around me, as well as my own character. For instance, grand theft auto.

So i’m not voting.
